section.name: How-to Guides
section.p: A few guides have been written to make it easier to get started using AndroMDA on your projects, on this page you will find the links to those guides.

ul.li:
Project Generator
Explains how to set up a new project template in which you use AndroMDA to generate code from your UML model. The project templates have been specifically designed for J2EE applications.

Bpm4Struts Cartridge
Bpm4Struts is a cartridge that is able to generate Struts code from activity graphs and use-cases. This guide briefly explains the way you should approach and eventually model your application's architecture. This is a one-page how-to featuring screenshots.

Spring Cartridge
The Spring cartridge is used to generate your application's back end, it generates Spring services (optionally wrapped by Session EJBs) using Hibernate POJOs for persistence. This guide includes seven pages of documentation including screenshots and examples of generate code. The spring-cartridge's features are listed and described.
